law.catch_line: Lump-sum payment to survivors of police officer killed in line of duty.

text.section: The board may award a lump-sum payment not to exceed twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000) to the family of a police officer employed by a city, county, or urban-county government who is killed in the line of duty as a police officer for such city, county, or urban-county and who is not eligible to receive death or disability benefits under a pension plan of the city, county, or urban-county.
This section shall apply to any officer killed in the line of duty since January 1, 1986.

law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 409, sec. 9, effective July 13, 1990. -- Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 324, sec. 1, effective April 4, 1986.
